title: G20 Brisbane: world leaders arrive for first official meeting â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: leaders dinner begins , live blog ends .
more needed to fight ebola - g20 leaders .
g20 leaders start first session , focused on global economic growth .
prime minister tony abbott addresses leaders at g20

documents.title: leaders dinner begins , live blog ends
text: and here is the serious photo .
with that , we 'll end the blog of g20 brisbane : day one .
thanks for sticking around .
guardian australia will be back on deck tomorrow to keep you across all the g20 news you can handle .
australia 's prime minister tony abbott ( front c ) is joined by heads of states and international organizations as they pose for the family photo during the g20 summit in brisbane .
khan/afp/getty images
there 's always one .
u.s. president barack obama , center , gives a thumbs-up sign during the g20 summit family photo in brisbane , australia , saturday , nov. 15 , 2014 .

with obama are from left to right , prime minister of new zealand , john key , chinese president xi jinping , british prime minister david cameron , president of mauritania mohamed ould abdel aziz , prime minister of india narendra modi , myanmar 's president thein sein , italian prime minister matteo renzi , and brazilian president dilma rousseff .
martinez monsivais/ap
let 's look back at today 's main g20 stories while the leaders head to tonight 's dinner .
by the looks of the live feed it is a long hot walk from the car to the venue .
some are handling the heat more than others , but at least they all get to sit down to an incredible meal .
once they sit down to eat , i 'll close the blog , cobble together some two minute noodles for myself and try not to question if i should have become a president instead .
tomorrow there will be another round of talks and the signing of the g20 communique .

us president obama gave a speech to a crowd at the university of queensland which contained several pointed remarks which might make one squirm a little if you had recently said anything about avoiding climate change discussions or if there was anything but bush in australia when the first fleet arrived .

the president also used a speech to confirm what was revealed by the guardian on friday : that the us would be contributing $ 3bn to the green climate fund that aims to help developing nations cope with the effects of global warming .

the queensland government is working feverishly behind the scenes lobbying unesco representatives to stop the great barrier reef from being listed as in danger by the un 's cultural and heritage body .
the escalating crisis in ukraine will be discussed by obama and five eu leaders present .
protests have continued throughout the day and despite the heat , in large numbers .
guardian australia 's joshua robertson has been on the ground following the demonstrations which he says cover pretty much everything .
his report coming soon .

vladimir putin is bracing for a catastrophic slump in oil prices as david cameron says europe would have no choice but to step up sanctions if the russian president did not abide by previous agreements to respect ukraine 's independence , patrick wintour reports .

australian treasurer , joe hockey , says governments risk losing their legitimacy in the eyes of the people if multinationals are allowed to continue avoid paying their fair share tax , daniel hurst reports .
g20 : day one - in
the opposition leader , bill shorten , has held a doorstop , continuing his remarks about abbott 's earlier speech .
shorten said he believed abbott had shocked world leaders with his desire to put national domestic politics front and centre of the g20 .
now is the time for tony abbott to move from opposition brawler to international statesman and frankly i thought his contribution this morning was nothing short of weird .
thanks to my colleague daniel hurst for that update .
i 'm inclined to agree with buzzfeed australia 's mark di stefano here .
mark di stefano ( @ markdistef ) the white house pool reports quickly becoming my favourite part of # g20brisbane
lame duck at home , but a lion away , writes guardian australia 's ben doherty on obama .
ben sat in the audience for the us president 's address earlier this afternoon .
he writes that despite the woes of the democracts back in the us obama can still call the shots - or at least push the agenda - at international leader hangouts .
despite abbott very much not wanting climate change anywhere on the agenda , obama 's speech was very much about just that .
and it was quite a hit with the relatively young audience .
read ben 's piece here .
us president barack obama addresses a crowd at the university of queensland ( uq ) in brisbane , saturday , nov. 15 , 2014 .
president obama is attending the g20 world leaders summit taking place in brisbane november 15-16 .
peled/aapimage

documents.title: more needed to fight ebola - g20 leaders
text: the g20 leaders have released their statement on the ebola crisis .

in a nutshell , the statement expresses sadness over the emergency in sierra leone , guinea and liberia , reinforces their commitment , and commends and applauds the work that has been done so far , but calls for more from everyone .
nations which have not pitched in yet must do so , those that have can do more , and ngos , civil society and the private sector must work with governments to mitigate further disasters .

in this regard , we urge the world bank group ( wbg ) and international monetary fund ( imf ) to continue their strong support for the affected countries and welcome the imf 's initiative to make available a further $ 300 million to stem the ebola outbreak and ease pressures on guinea , liberia and sierra leone , through a combination of concessional loans , debt relief , and grants .
we ask the imf and wbg to explore new , flexible mechanisms to address the economic effects of future comparable crises .
g20 members must recommit to the world health organisation 's international health regulations , the statement reads .

to this end , and in the context of our broader efforts to strengthen health systems globally , we commit to support others to implement the ihr and to build capacity to prevent , detect , report early and rapidly respond to infectious diseases like ebola .
we also commit to fight anti-microbial resistance .

interested g20 members are supporting this goal through initiatives to accelerate action across the economic community of west african states and other vulnerable regions and will report progress and announce a time frame by may 2015 at the world health assembly .
read the statement in full here .
abc radio brisbane ( @ 612brisbane ) `` can i have you looking at my camera ? ''
says the lead photographer # g20 # familyphoto
vladimir putin was on the far left ( of the photo ) .
angela merkel was also in the front row .
the g20 leaders were very efficient and it was all done and dusted in a matter of minutes .
i 'll get some more information to you shortly , then we can all speculate about the politics of positioning politicians .

documents.title: leaders pose for a photo
text: the leaders have finished their meeting and are now getting together for the class photo .
abbott is front and centre .
the photographer is being exactly as bossy as i imagine he would be with an actual school class .
back to another of the increasingly infamous aspects of g20 get-togethers : protests .

sister susan connelly , a josephite nun who has spent years working with east timor , has joined with getup to draw attention to the contentious history between australia and east timor , particularly regarding our negotiations over $ 40bn worth of oil and gas reserves .
they have put together the below tv ad , to air in brisbane over the weekend while all the leaders and delegates are here .
we 're haranguing nations for not working together , yet one of the poorest nations in asia is just a stone 's throw away , she said .
our gdp is 750 times bigger than east timor 's , but we 're holding them in abject poverty by refusing them their fair share .
hello all .
helen davidson checking in to take over for the afternoon .
thanks to bridie for the extensive coverage of all the day 's diplomatic goings on .
as the leaders remain locked in the first session , here 's a look at one of the attractions on offer at the media centre .
media centres are not normally this entertaining , i can assure you .
christian bennett ( @ christianobeno ) the first media centre to feature and actual snake .
# g20 @ twitterid
as the leaders continue in their first session it is time for me to bid you adieu , my colleague helen davidson will take you through the next hour and possibly beyond .
we have the seating plan for the first session of the g20 .
in a stroke of diplomatic brilliance , or maybe the seating is always set out this way , it seems everyone is in alphabetical order .
as the president australia has prime position , to the left is argentina and to the right in united states of america who then has the united kingdom next to them .
russia has ended up between the republic of korea and saudi arabia g20 brisbane : leaders plenary seating plan
we can only speculate how heated the first session of the g20 is but in the media room we have a living and breathing illustration of how heated brisbane itself is .
a colleague informs me he witnessed a delegate take off his shirt , wring the sweat out ( i 'll just let you absorb that image for a minute .
maybe in the manner his shirt absorbed his sweat ) and then attempt to dry it out under a hand dryer .
i am assuming it was not a delegate from our heat familiar region .
we must spare a thought for the poor chap tomorrow when temperatures are tipped to hit 37 degrees .
today it was 33 degrees .

documents.title: g20 leaders start first session , focused on global economic growth
text: the australian prime minister , tony abbott , has delivered the opening remarks at the first session of the g20 .

he says there have been difficulties and problems around the world , particularly in the middle east , eastern europe and west africa and it was the job of the g20 to deliver a message of hope and optimism .
yes , our world can grow and , yes , our world can deliver the jobs that our people want .
there have been many conferences which have talked about what we want .
this conference , thanks to the good work of our finance ministers , thanks to the good work of our officials , is about how we will deliver .
abbott spoke confidently about achieving the target set by the g20 finance ministers of global gdp growth of 2 % over the next five years .
yes , we want freer trade and we will deliver it .
yes , we need more infrastructure and we will build it .
yes , we are embarked on a series of important structural reforms and we will deliver them and we need fiscal consolidation so that we can live within our means .
in the brief remarks he did not mention climate change which was one of the major issues addressed in barack obama 's speech earlier in the afternoon .
australian prime minister , tony abbott , has personally welcomed each of the g20 leaders including russian president , vladimir putin , and american president , barack obama .

australian prime minister tony abbott ( left ) greets us president barack obama during the official welcome at the brisbane convention and exhibitions centre ( bcec ) in brisbane , saturday , ( aap image/lukas coch ) coch/aapimage
there has just been a welcome to country for the leaders at the g20 and in this humble liveblogger 's opinion it is one of the most moving i have witnessed .
the song woman was followed by aboriginal dancers and then the torres strait island dance company before dancers from the bangarra dance theatre finished it .
7news brisbane ( @ 7newsbrisbane ) a colourful display of australia 's indigenous culture in front of world leaders at the # g20 summit in # brisbane .
australian prime minister , tony abbott , has greeted russian president vladimir putin at the g20 ahead of the first official session .
jennifer rajca ( @ jrajca ) anyone a russian body language expert ?
president putin meets tony abbott before the world 's cameras in brisbane # g20
we have footage of barack obama 's full speech to the university of queensland at the g20 where he spoke on importance of tackling climate change , america 's pivot to asia and global inequality .
barack obama speaks at university of queensland .
australian prime minister tony abbott 's wife , margie abbott , has hosted the spouses of the g20 at the lone pine koala sanctuary as part of the spouse 's program .
it seems if there are any male spouses of the g20 world leaders , they have not come along to brisbane .
notable absences are michelle obama and samantha cameron .
in this handout photo provided by the g20 australia , spouses of g20 leaders pose for a photo at the lone pine koala sanctuary , as part of the g20 leaders spouse program .
photo by penny bradfield/g20 australia via getty images .
/getty images

australian prime minister , tony abbott , is now greeting world leaders at the brisbane convention and exhibition centre ahead of the first session which will be on the global economy and focus what the g20 is doing to deliver growth and jobs .
the finance leaders of the g20 have already agreed on a gdp growth target of 2 % and this session will focus on exactly how that will achieved .
can you spot the difference ?
courier mail photographer , adam smith , was sent to photograph barack obama in the beast only to discover two beasts and two obamas .
it is not often obama 's decoy is spotted and it is almost creepy how much he looks like the president .
bridie jabour ( @ bkjabour ) courier mail photographer has captured obama 's decoy at the # g20 i think the real obama is on the left .
a protester has been charged and banned from the g20 exclusion zone , abc reports : a woman has been charged after being found with a gas mask at a g20 protest .
the mask was discovered when officers searched the belongings of two women at a rally in brisbane city , police said .
one woman was released without charge but the other was taken into custody and charged with possession of a prohibited item .
both women have been excluded from the g20 area .
in the wake of obama 's speech we can now turn our attention back to the g20 protests .
some snapshots from my colleague joshua robertson and various other people on the ground .
andree withey ( @ andreewithey ) two g20 protestors detained and searched at police headquarters .
brisbane solidarity network .
@ twitterid # g20 cameron atfield ( @ cameronatfield ) this photograph brought to you by two forceful shoves from heavy handed police .
joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) `` nude '' protesters .

really need to go naked in this heat # g20 @ twitterid joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) soda pop the protest dog # g20brisbane @ twitterid mark di stefano ( @ markdistef ) police have just punted a man with an amputated leg from protest cause he posed a security risk # g20brisbane joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) local elder gets biggest clap from rally crowd with this line : `` fuck the g20 '' britt vonow ( @ bvonow ) contents of protestors ' bags # g20 @ twitterid bernadette young ( @ byoungbris ) police well outnumber protesters at a pro-russian rally in south bank .
# g20brisbane # g20 / @ 612brisbane joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) biggest g20 protest was peaceful , police & demonstrators happy , no known arrests on foot # g20 @ twitterid

here 's photos from barack obama 's address to the university of queensland where he was not backwards in coming forward on climate change despite tony abbott 's wish that it not be a focus of the g20 .
his message was blunt - we need to act , and we need to do it quickly .
u.s. president barack obama speaks at the university of queensland .
reuters/kevin lamarque lamarque/reuters with australia 's former governor-general .

ben doherty ( @ bendohertycorro ) obama shakes hands with former gg quentin bryce , qld premier newman alongside her 7news brisbane ( @ 7newsbrisbane ) what a crowd pleaser - @ twitterid was practically hugging guests at # uq after delivering his historic speech !
barack obama is branching out into global inequality , both social and economic .

he says we should partner with poorer countries to build stronger public health systems and new treatments to save lives , not just because it is charitable but out of self interest because we are all linked .

what we 've learned from the ebola outbreak is that in this globalised world where the pacific is like a lake , if countries are so poor that they ca n't afford basic public health infrastructure that threatens our health .
we can not build a moat around our countries and we should n't try .
what we should be doing is making sure everybody has some basic public health system that allow for early warning when outbreaks of infectious disease may occur .
he says the rights of the minority should be stood up for because no-one 's equality should be denied adn that includes gay and lesbian people as well as women .
obama finishes by saying he is confident the security , prosperity and dignity of people across the asian pacific region can be advanced by working together .
so thanks very much , god bless australia , god bless america , god bless our great alliance .
barack obama has singled out the great barrier reef as at risk of destruction from climate change as reports emerged queensland is lobbying the un not to classify it as in danger .
i have not had time to go to the great barrier reef and i want to come back and i want my daughters to be able to come back and i want them to be able to bring their daughters or sons to visit .
and i want that there 50 years from now .
now president barack obama is speaking on climate change , something australia did not want a focus of the g20 , preferring to look towards economic reform instead .
here in the asia pacific nobody has more at stake when it comes to thinking about and then acting on climate change .
here a climate that increases in temperature will mean more extreme and frequent storms , more flooding , rising seas that submerge pacific islands .
here in australia it means longer droughts , more wildfires .
the incredible natural glory of the great barrier reef is threatened .
worldwide this past summer was the hottest on record .
no nation is immune and every nation has a responsibility to do its part .
and you will recall at the beginning i said the us andaustralia has a lot in common .
well one of the things we havein common is we produce a lot of carbon .
part of it 's this legacy of wide open spaces and the frontier mentality and this incredible abundance of resources and so historically we have not been the most energy efficient of nations .
which means we 've got to step up .
obama has called on the world to set a target on reducing greenhouse emissions .

setting up a target , sends a powerful message to the world that all countries , whether you are a developed country , a developing country or somewhere in between , you 've got to be able to overcome old divides , look squarely at the science and reach a strong global climate agreement next year .
barack obama is talking about america 's pivot to asia , or rebalancing of foreign policy as he calls it .
our rebalance is not only about the united states doing more in asia , it 's also about the asia pacific region doing more with us around the world .
so i 'm here today to say that american leadership in the asia pacific will always be a fundamental focus of my foreign policy .
it wo n't always make the headlines .
it wo n't always be measured in the number of trips i make , although i do keep coming back .

but day in and dayout , steadily and deliberately , we will continue to deepen our engagement using every element of american power - diplomacy , military , economic , development , the power of our values and our ideals .

he says america will continue to engage with japan and korea , it will continue to modernise defence posture across the region and it will continue to engage with emerging economies such as vietnam and indonesia .

documents.title: barack obama addresses brisbane
text: barack obama has opened his speech with some locally targeted jokes and lingo referring to brisvegas - a nickname for brisbane - and xxxx beer , the local beer ( which locals have mixed feelings about ) .
he speaks about how the world is getting smaller and is less violent with dictatorships around the world giving way to democracies .
he singles out north korea 's nuclear program , poverty and climate change as major problems the world faces today .
when you look at the facts , opportunities are limitless for this generation .
you are living in an extraordinary time .
but what is also true is that alongside this dynamism there are genuine dangers that can undermine progress .
we ca n't look at those problems through rose-tinted glasses .
north korea 's nuclear and missile programs , that 's a problem .
disputes over territory , remote islands and rocky shoals that threaten to spiral into confrontation .
the failure to uphold universal human rights , denying justice to citizens and denying countries their full potential .
economic inequality and extreme poverty that are a recipe for instability .
and energy demands in growing cities that also hasten trends towards a changing climate .
australian opposition leader , bill shorten , had some unusually strongly worded criticism for a speech to world leaders , labelling tony abbott 's address to the g20 leaders whingeing .
abbott used his speech to the leaders ' retreat earlier in the day to say how difficult it has been to fix the budget , deregulate universities and introduce a $ 7 co-payment for the gp .
shorten has attacked the domestically focussed speech in remarks reported by the daily telegraph .
at best , this was weird and graceless .
at worst , it was a disastrous missed opportunity for australia .
this was tony abbott 's moment in front of the most important and influential leaders in the world and he 's whingeing that australians do n't want his gp tax .
this was his opportunity to show why australia should be considered a world leader , he 's had months to prepare for this moment .
instead he boasted of taking australia backwards on climate change action , making it harder for australians to go to university and pricing sick people out of getting the healthcare they need .
the wheelin ' and dealin ' behind the scenes of the g20 can be just as interesting as the official outcomes , possibly moreso .
there 's a slew of side meetings going on and some serious lobbying , in particular by the queensland government .
apparently it does not want the great barrier reef listed as in danger by the un 's cultural and heritage body and telling them so , my colleague ben doherty reports here .

meetings between world leaders taking place on the side lines include : russian president vladimir putin with : german chancellor angela merkel brics ( brazil , russia , india , china , south africa ) french president francois hollande italian pm matteo renzi uk pm david cameron indian pm narendra modi with : uk pm david cameron australian pm tony abbott eu president herman van rompuy japanese pm shinzo abe ( dinner ) german chancellor angela merkel ( sidelines ) spanish pm mariano rajoy ( sidelines ) informal brics gathering canadian pm stephen harper us president barack obama is having a trilateral meeting with japan 's pm shinzo abe and australian pm tony abbott .
abbott also had dinner on friday night with indonesian president joko widodo and saturday bilateral meetings with spain ( president mariano rajoy ) and italy ( prime minister matteo renzi ) .
guardian australia 's ben doherty is at the university of queensland awaiting barack obama 's speech .

he reports on waiting for obama : a few [ australian ] political types in the uq hall pass the time ahead of obama 's speech - senator ian macfarlane and speaker bronwyn bishop on the coalition side , labor deputy leader tanya plibersek , and former treasurer wayne swan ( in his shirt-sleeves ) from labor .
tim costello is here from world vision too .
but the overwhelming majority of the audience is students , university and high school ( in uniform on a saturday ! ) .
it 's a young crowd , gripped by a sense of anticipation and of occasion .
the event has the vibe of a college campus pep rally .
an enormous star spangled banner is balanced by an equally massive australian flag on the other side of the stage .
music by brooks and dunn and stevie wonder ( signed , sealed , delivered , i 'm yours ) , blares out from speakers .
us presidential speeches are carefully-choreographed productions .
president obama 's audience awaits a performance .
ben doherty ( @ bendohertycorro ) peter hoj , vc of uq , speaking ahead of @ twitterid 'the warm-up band before the rolling stones '

australian prime minister , tony abbott , has been attacked by russian media and accused of being part of a western plot to blame the country for the downing of mh17 , the australian financial review reports : russia 's top rating news program has launched an extraordinary attack on prime minister tony abbott and hinted he is part of a cynical and deliberate western plot to blame russia for the mh17 tragedy .
the attack aired on russian state channel ort at the top of its national evening news bulletin in a special report by mikhail leontyev , a well known pundit with close links to the kremlin .
it comes as russian president vladimir putin joins other leaders in brisbane this weekend for the g20 summit .
we know that at the summit in brisbane australian prime minister abbott is threatening to ask our president some tough questions about the malaysian boeing .
let 's try to help him , mr leontyev said .
we can reveal the seating plan at the leaders ' barbecue which australian prime minister tony abbott is hosting at queensland 's parliament house .
russia is not within shirtfronting distance from australia with vladimir putin seated between korea and argentina .
america is sharing a table with the united kingdom , japan , turkey , france , south africa and the european council .
bridie jabour ( @ bkjabour ) seating plan from the # g20 leaders barbecue .
russia between argentina & korea .

australia between indonesia and india there is also more detail on the spread being offered at the leaders ' retreat which is a barbecue at queensland 's parliament : salads : cairns vannella co. buffalo mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and basil bbqd new season asparagus , peas , broad beans , goat 's curd and mount zero wild olives kale salad with broccoli , avocado and toasted seeds seafood : freshly shucked moreton bay rock oysters cooked mooloolaba king prawns with lime mayonnaise barbecue : moreton bay bugs , figs , pancetta and fresh bay kebabs with chimmichurri smoked and s flinders island butterflied leg of lamb with yoghurt and eggplant cripsy skin tasmanian ocean trout , avocado , apple , radish and watercress salad dessert : australian pavlova
american president barack obama is scheduled to make a speech at the university of queensland in a touch over an hour .
our man on the ground , ben doherty , reports lines made up mostly of students in the 31 degree heat .
ben doherty ( @ bendohertycorro ) queue to see obama stretching more than 200m .
oppressively hot , still 2 hours till he speaks ben doherty ( @ bendohertycorro ) in case his audience forgets who 's talking , 1xlectern , 1x50ft flag # neverleavehomewithoutit
australian treasurer , joe hockey , has addressed the finance ministers at the g20 meeting saying he is optimistic the group 's 2 % growth target for the global economy will be achieved .
i want to emphasise that my finance minister colleagues and i are resolute in our determination to use all policy levers to generate growth and jobs .
today we discussed the current economic outlook .
we welcome the support for global activity flowing from the asian region and the signs of growth from , the united states , the united kingdom , spain and canada .
we also , of course , discussed the challenges of delivering growth , particularly in japan and europe .

documents.title: reports of protester arrests
text: there are reports from brisbane-based journalists that there have been arrests at g20 protests .
brisbane times reporters natalie bochenski and cameron atfield have tweeted an arrest after a bag search and two female protesters being brought into a police station .
natalie bochenski ( @ girlclumsy ) two young women have been brought into @ twitterid hq from protest .
# g20brisbane cameron atfield ( @ cameronatfield ) we 've had an arrest at roma street following a bag search .
buzzfeed oz 's mark di stefano estimates 2,000 protesters have gathered in brisbane for the g20 summit .
vine of protesters gathering what are they protesting ?
mark di stefano ( @ markdistef ) @ bkjabour everything .
pick an issue and they 're protesting it joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) protester with anonymous mask - no bother from police at all # g20 @ twitterid

documents.title: prime minister tony abbott addresses leaders at g20
text: australian prime minister , tony abbott , is addressing the leaders at the g20 summit .
he emphasises that he would like the talks to be about economic reform ( ie , not climate change ) but says it is ultimately up to the leaders what they talk about .

now we have heavy responsibilities , all of us , the world is looking to all of us right now to try to demonstrate to an uncertain and at times anxious world there are people who know what they are doing , that there are people who have a plan , a plan for growth and for jobs and that 's our challenge , to leave this g20 meeting in 48 hours ' time having instilled more confidence in the people of the world that there is a better and brighter future for all of us .
abbott then goes into a lot of his domestic issues .

he says he was elected to do four things : repeal the carbon tax stop the illegal boats coming into the country start building the roads get the budget under control now i have to say that this has proven massively difficult .
massively difficult .

because it does n't matter what spending program you look at , it does n't matter how wasteful that spending program might appear , there are always some people in the community who vote , who love that program very much .
so getting the budget under control has proven extremely difficult .

if i could speak candidly with you , what i have tried to do is not only get the budget back under control but also try to bring about important economic reforms , important liberalisations at the same time .
abbott says it has been particularly difficult to sell university deregulation and the $ 7 gp co-payment to the australian people .
i do n't have any magic answers to the problems that we face .

i think that all we can do is explain the reasons as carefully as we can and to persist for as long as we can with these reforms but the more gatherings like this that can affirm the importance of good policy , the more gatherings like this that can affirm the importance of governments not over-promising things that are unaffordable and undeliverable , then i think the easier it is for all of us to deliver good policy to the people of our countries .

so i hope is what we can do over the next hour and three quarters or so , is have a very candid and very honest discussion about where we think our countries can and should go , both individually and collectively over the next few years .
despite australia 's best efforts it seems climate change may end up being a key issue of the g20 .
guardian australia 's political editor , lenore taylor , reports pressure from europe and america for strong commitments at the g20 on climate change has succeeded to some extent .
however , the green climate fund is a sticking point .
the full report is here .

back to our man on the ground , joshua robertson , for what has been happening around the official leader 's meetings and barbecues : joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) waiting for the motorcade so we can cross the road .
# g20 @ twitterid joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) catering worker told by police he ca n't cross to south bank to get to work , where he will feed police .

# g20 @ twitterid joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) falun gong protesters , a fixture of king george sq but especially now xi jingping in town # g20 @ twitterid joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) qld state ministers obviously no security risk .
dep premier jeff seeney with a single minder for a coffee in twin square # g20 @ twitterid
un secretary-general , ban ki-moon .
says the international community 's response to ebola has been panicked but there is a need to guard against the panic .
ebola issue started seemingly as health issue .
that is why the international community might be a little bit slow in tackling this ebola issue .
now ebola issue has developed into security , not only health , but economy and security issues .

so it is nowimpacting whole spectrum of our life and that is why united nations has taken an emergency response for the first time in the history of the united nations , the un has established a special mission to respond to ebola now we need to mobilise massive resources in terms of financial , logistics and treatment .
we need to provide all political support to them .

documents.title: ban ki-moon says climate change defining issue of our time
text: un secretary-general , ban ki-moon , is taking questions in brisbane after urging world leaders to act decisively on climate change .
guardian australia 's political editor , lenore taylor , asked : you spoke about the green climate fund in your remarks .

would you like to see the g20 communique address that issue and it 's been suggested this meeting is primarily about economic growth and is n't primarily about climate change but you were calling on countries , g20 countries to take a lead .
can you explainwhy you think it is appropriate ?
ki-moon responded : it 's my understanding , i have been briefed by my sherpa that they are actively discussing the issue of a climate change .

of course climate change is the defining issue of our times , therefore it 's only natural that g20 leaders should focus much more on this as part of making this world sustainable in three dimensions- economic , social and environmental .
australian prime minister tony abbott met with italy 's prime minister , matteo renzi , this morning ahead of the leader 's retreat and official talks .
he also met with spain 's president mariano rajoy .
tony abbott , right , greets italy 's prime minister matteo renzi , left , during a bilateral meeting at the g20 leaders ' summit in brisbane .
/william west/aap the g20 is becoming just as well known for its protests as it is for the actual leaders ' meetings .
people demanding more action on fighting ebola have dressed in hazmat suits in the 33 degree heat as part of their protest .
activists dressed as frontline ebola health workers protest to demand g20 action to fight the disease .
munoz/getty images
un secretary-general , ban ki-moon , is speaking at the g20 summit and is coming out very strongly on the need to combat climate change .
the transition towards a low carbon , climate-resilient future is accelerating .
i urge other leaders and major economies , especially among the g20 , to come forward with contributions to sustain this momentum .
the world also looks to the g20 to lead on climate finance .
i urge g20 leaders to make ambitious pledges towards the capitalisation of the green climate fund , gcf and next week 's conference in berlin , germany .
ki-moon commends the united states and china for their joint-pledge to reduce greenhouse emissions .
as the latest ipcc report tells us , we must act quickly and decisively .
if we want to avoid increasing the destructive outcomes but we also have the means to limit climate change and have a better future .

the new european commission president , jean-claude juncker , took three questions at his press conference but refused to answer whether he should stand aside pending the investigation into luxleaks , patrick wintour reports .
juncker was prime minister of luxemburg between 1995 and 2013 and it has emerged in the past few weeks the country has been used by a slew of multinational organisations to avoid paying tax .
american president , barack obama , has arrived at the leader 's retreat for a barbecue hosted by tony abbott for the world 's leaders with no officials or staffers supposedly involved .
on the menu ?
it could porterhouse steak as well as tender warwick lamb cooked in good-quality rathdowney olive oil , news.com.au reports .
according to the website 100 chefs have been toiling for 14 hours a day in preparation for the 25 world leaders and 4,000 delegates .
on the menus across breakfast , lunch and dinner : moreton bay bugs , prawns and crab .
in total , 25,000kg of fresh produce has been ordered for 100,000 meals .
10,000 croissants and 5000 danish pastries 100,000 cups of fresh aussie coffee 30,000 pieces of bowen mangoes and sunshine coast pineapples timtams and pavlova penfolds wine
brisbane 's newspaper the courier-mail is known for its interesting front pages and has lived up to its reputation during the g20 .
a sample from the past few days : joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) russian bear & skippy to punch on ?
courier-mail splash on abbott 's beef with putin # g20 @ twitterid german embassy in oz ( @ germanyinoz ) thank you courier mail for this awesome front page - welcome to paradise !
the courier-mail ( @ couriermail ) today 's front page .
# g20 # g20brisbane
the leaders are currently at queensland parliament house for a barbecue hosted by tony abbott .
it is meant to be a semi-informal meeting before the serious business kicks off this afternoon .
treasurer , joe hockey , is due to address the media shortly where he will making a statement but not be taking any questions .
lenore taylor tells me foreign minister , julie bishop , was going to do a walk through the media room at 9.30am and then take questions but called it off at 9.45am .

a quick rundown of the stories out of g20 so far : vladimir putin is bracing for a catastrophic slump in oil prices as david cameron says europe would have no choice but to step up sanctions if the russian president did not abide by previous agreements to respect ukraine 's independence , patrick wintour reports .

australian treasurer , joe hockey , says governments risk losing their legitimacy in the eyes of the people if multinationals are allowed to continue avoid paying their fair share tax , daniel hurst reports .
china has been chosen above japan to be the president of the g20 in 2016 with the decision expected to be made official tomorrow , the australian reports .
the abc has put together a feature on protesters ' messages to world leaders in brisbane for the g20 .
it is a great piece of digital journalism .
australia has already been seen to be out of step with other countries on climate change after america and china made a joint pledge to reduce their greenhouse gas output .
now the guardian has revealed barack obama is going to pledge billions of dollars to poorer countries to fight climate change .

suzanne goldenberg and lenore taylor report : barack obama will make a substantial pledge to a fund to help poor countries fight climate change , again putting the us at odds with australia , which hasargued against diplomatic efforts for g20 leaders to promise more contributions to the fund .
america plans to pledge at least us $ 2.5bn ( aus $ 2.88bn ) and as much as us $ 3bn over the next four years to the green climate fund , according to those briefed by administration officials .

the fund aims to help poorer countries cut their emissions and prepare for the impact of climate change , and is seen as critical to securing developing-nation support for a successful deal on reducing emissions at the un meeting in paris next year .

tony abbott had previously insisted australia would not make any contributions to the fund , although it is understood the department of foreign affairs and trade , which leads australia 's negotiating position in international climate talks , has been considering whether canberra should make a pledge .
sources said no final decision had been made .
in the lead up to the g20 leaders in the city emphasised to locals brisbane would be very much open for business during the g20 but it seems most people have still fled the city .
our man on the ground , joshua robertson , reports : it 's like a ghost town , is n't it ?
says one city-appointed g20 volunteer.even the outer commercial hubs of brisbane , like indooroopilly 8km from the city centre , are eerily quiet today .
months of warnings from civic leaders about the inconvenient impact of security zones , motorcades and road closures seem to have taken their toll .
tv reports say short term accommodation is booked out in neighbouring toowoomba and ipswich .
joshua robertson ( @ jrojourno ) a kangaroos'eye view of brisbane town square .
sun baked & virtually empty # g20 @ twitterid
german chancellor angela merkel swung by caxton street in brisbane last night for a drink .
caxton street is one of the most popular strip of bars and pubs in the queensland capital and where post-football matches commiserations and celebrations usually take place .
merkel was captured on video meeting and greeting .
angela merkel in caxton street there were even selfies !
the courier-mail ( @ couriermail ) german chancellor angela merkel having a good time in caxton street .
pic : sarah keayes
my colleague joshua robertson is on the ground in brisbane which has had to welcome snipers as well as world leaders .
he reports : people in brisbane are just starting to notice the scattered rooftop snipers for g20 - but some have quietly been in place for well over a week .
one high rise health care facility in the city 's south welcomed their sniper as a deterrent to the imagined threat of protesters unfurling large banners from their rooftop .
we have of some of the arrivals this morning and last night .
the poor attorney-general george brandis got caught on the tarmac without sunscreen or a hat while waiting for obama this morning .
a sunburned attorney-general george brandis waits for us president barack obama to arrive at raaf base amberley in brisbane , saturday , nov. 15 , 2014 .
world economic are in brisbane to attend the g20 leadership summit on november 15-16 .
( aap image/lukas coch ) no archivingnewscurrent affairspoliticspoliticalpoliticianpoliticians coch/aapimage italy pm matteo renzi also arrived this morning in one of the more stylish contingents .
italy 's prime minister matteo renzi ( r ) arrives at the g20 terminal in brisbane .
/reuters vladimir putin arrived last night and much has been made about the dignitaries , or lack thereof , who were waiting to greet him .
queensland 's governor paul de jersey was the most senior person waiting for him .

brisbane , australia - november 14 : russia 's president vladimir putin ( front ) and russian ambassador to canberra , vladimir morozov step off the plane during the arrival ceremony at the brisbane airport .
/ barcroft media tony abbott looked very pleased to be with his second bff ( the first being canada 's stephen harper ) david cameron .
the pair arrived in brisbane on the same plane and even had a co-ordinated wave .
british prime minister david cameron ( l ) and australian prime minister tony abbott arrive at brisbane airport to attend the g20 summit in brisbane .
xinhua / eyevine/xinhua / eyevine
good morning and welcome to the g20 liveblog .
i 'll be guiding you through the days events now that most of the world leaders have touched down in ( very ) sunny queensland .
today there 's going to be a leader 's retreat , where the various presidents , prime ministers and heads of state can kick back with each other with no staff or officials around .
camp breaking the ice games spring to mind .
now let 's start climbing this g20 summit .

bulletin.text: The G20 summit got under way at the Brisbane convention centre as leaders were formally welcomed for the plenary session. ¢ This blog is closed. G20 day two coverage can be found here.
